entry.title: SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow in India
entry.content:
¬°Hola SAP Developers!

I've got some exciting news to share with you. We are organising an SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow in India!

I understand that in July, it is still season for the king of fruits in India (ü•≠ mango, obviously), and my colleague @ajay_soreng and I ( @ajmaradiaga ) will go on the hunt for the best mango variety in India... while we do a few CodeJams on our roadshow üòã.  We will have three stops on the roadshow from July 14th to 18th, 2025, doing a total of five CodeJams, one in Mumbai, two in Hyderabad, and two more in Bengaluru :-).

Connecting systems and services using SAP Integration Suite

This SAP CodeJam instance will be about SAP Integration Suite and how we can use it to connect systems and services in our landscape.

Event-driven integration with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh

This SAP CodeJam instance will be about event-driven architectures focusing on SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. During the CodeJam, we will cover different technologies/tools: SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, SAP Cloud Integration, SAP Business Application Studio, CloudEvents, and Node.js.

SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Bengaluru, India)

This is the all-new SAP CodeJam for SAP Build low-code/no-code tooling that focuses on giving you hands-on experience for building event-triggered processes with SAP Build Process Automation.

SAP CodeJam events part of the roadshow (Register Now!)

Below is a listing of the SAP CodeJam events on the roadshow schedule:

Dates

CodeJam topic

Location

Registration

14 July

Connecting systems and services using SAP Integration Suite

Mumbai üáÆüá≥

Link

15 July

Event-driven integrations with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh #1

Hyderabad üáÆüá≥

Link

16 July

Event-driven integrations with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh #2

Hyderabad üáÆüá≥

Link

17 July

SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Bengaluru, India)

Bengaluru üáÆüá≥

Link

18 July

Connecting systems and services using SAP Integration Suite

Bengaluru üáÆüá≥

Link

Make sure to register to secure your place. It is likely that the places available will go fast. See you all somewhere in India on the roadshow!

entry.title: üáßüá∑ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core (S√£o Paulo, Brazil)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need to have any background in the topic, but a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use text chunks and embeddings to improve your RAG response.

This is a free in-person event and is planned for Friday, July 25th in S√£o Paulo, Brazil üáßüá∑ from 09:30 to 14:30 local time. The language of the event and the content will be in English. The instructors are @josh_bentley and @SavioMarques10 from SAP.

The event is kindly being hosted by Exed Consulting in the Exed AppHaus S√£o Paulo, thank you! Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees. 

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Visit the SAP CodeJam group for more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees.

entry.title: üáµüá™ SAP CodeJam ABAP Cloud (Lima, Peru)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of the ABAP Cloud, and specifically introduces attendees to ABAP Cloud and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model. ABAP Cloud is the ABAP based development model for S/4HANA Cloud, S/4HANA on premise, and SAP BTP, ABAP environment. Learn how to use proven and new technologies, such as Core Data Services (CDS) and behavior definition and implementation languages, to build SAP Fiori apps and OData services on any of the ABAP Cloud options. In this hands-on experience, developers will create their first ABAP applications using ABAP Cloud, expose and consume services via HTTP, and explore the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Monday 4 August 2025 in Lima, Peru  from 09:30 - 15:30 local time. The language of the event and the content will be English.

Location: SAP Peru SAC, Av. Club Golf los Incas 154, Santiago de Surco 15023, Peru

The instructor is Developer Advocate @RichHeilman 

Here are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: abap-exercises-codejam/prerequisites.md at main ¬∑ SAP-samples/abap-exercises-codejam (github.com).

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Quedada SAP - Let's talk about Joule - Bogota üá®üá¥ #SAPCodeJamsLATAM
entry.content:
The local SAP Community in Bogota has a chance to meet after our first of two local SAP CodeJams!

Quedada SAP in Bogota will happen on August 11th, 2024 at 18:00 local time for a few hours, so join us and be a part of our Group!  You don't have to be an attendee of our SAP CodeJam events, just someone active or curious about the SAP Community and our focus on #developers

Let‚Äôs talk about what's new in the SAP world, about interesting SAP projects in the region, and what's new with ourselves.

Please let us know if you will participate in SAP Stammtisch by clicking "I will attend", at the BBC Cerveceria that's in the W Hotel @ Avenida Carrera 9 #115 - 30, Bogota 110111 Colombia.  FYI, everyone is responsible for their own to buy a food/drink item if they wish, we are just happy for the chance to connect in person and have some relaxing conversation!

Click here to find more information about the SAP Developer Advocates Latin America Roadshow

entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow 2025 - Latin America edition üáßüá∑ üáµüá™ üá≤üáΩ üá®üá¥ (July 25th - Aug 12th 2025)
entry.content:
¬°Hola SAP Developers!

I've got some exciting news to share with you. The SAP CodeJam roadshow is coming back to Latin America! This time, Josh Bentley, Rich Heilman, Thomas Jung, and Antonio Maradiaga will be part of the second SAP CodeJam Roadshow in Latin America.  We will have four stops on the roadshow starting the 25th of July and then continuing from August 4th - 12th, 2025, doing a total of seven CodeJams, one in S√£o Paulo and then two in Lima, Mexico City and Bogota. Also, we'll organise a couple of quedadas (meetups) as we did last year. :-).

Check out the featured guests list in each event to learn which Developer Advocate(s) will be at the different events/locations.

 

SAP CodeJam ABAP Cloud

This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of the ABAP Cloud, and specifically introduces attendees to ABAP Cloud and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model. ABAP Cloud is the ABAP based development model for S/4HANA Cloud, S/4HANA on premise, and SAP BTP, ABAP environment. Learn how to use proven and new technologies, such as Core Data Services (CDS) and behavior definition and implementation languages, to build SAP Fiori apps and OData services on any of the ABAP Cloud options. In this hands-on experience, developers will create their first ABAP applications using ABAP Cloud, expose and consume services via HTTP, and explore the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model.

Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core

In this CodeJam, you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use text chunks and embeddings to improve your RAG response.

SAP CodeJam events and quedadas (meetups) part of the roadshow (Register Now!)

Below is a listing of the SAP CodeJam events and quedadas (meetups) on the roadshow schedule:

Dates

CodeJam topic

Make sure to register to secure your place. It is likely that the places available will go fast.

What if the CodeJam topics do not cover the SAP technology that you focus on? We've organised additional local meetups just to get together and have a chat. See you all somewhere in Latin America on the roadshow!

entry.title: üáÆüá≥ SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Bengaluru, India)
entry.content:
This is the all-new SAP CodeJam for SAP Build low-code/no-code tooling that focuses on giving you hands-on experience for building event-triggered processes with SAP Build Process Automation.

You will build an event-based scenario that lets users create S/4HANA business partners, setting off a process where:

  1. An employee approves the creation of a site access badge.
  2. A second employee, determined based on the details of the business partner, may also need to approve the badge.
  3. The process calls an external, 3rd-party badge system and waits to be called back.
  4. A user creates the badge and the badge system calls back the process instance.
  5. A notification with the badge ID is sent.

The scenario is built in 2 halves:

  • SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh: You will learn about events, CloudEvents, events in the SAP landscape, the process for publishing and subscribing to events, and your way around SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Then, you will create a REST Delivery Point in advanced event mesh to forward events to your SAP Build on your SAP BTP trial account.
  • SAP Build Process Automation: You will create a process from scratch to handle the issuance of site access badges. You will learn the basics of SAP Build Process Automation (projects, triggers, conditions, creating instances, monitoring, and the Inbox), and also use some of the more recent or advanced features (event triggers, form events, waiting for a API callback).

Prerequisites

  • Bring your own laptop with power adapter and have a supported Web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox installed on your laptop.
  • It can be helpful to bring a tablet or second laptop, if you have.
  • Complete these prerequisites and the required reading BEFORE you come: 
    • Introduction to the CodeJam
    • Prerequisites
    • Required reading:
      • 1 - Exploring Events and More in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub
      • 2 - Why Event-Driven Architectures?

Location and Date 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Thrusday, July 17, 2025 from 09:00 - 14:00 local time in Bengaluru, India. The language of the event and the content will be English.

Event Address: Building BLR05 (Room - SAP Hive) @ SAP Labs, EPIP Zone Whitefield Road, KIADB Export Promotion Industrial Area, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

  • The instructors are SAP Developer Advocates @ajay_soreng, @ajmaradiaga and @eshrinivasan.

Please note that spaces are limited! We can only accommodate 30 attendees. If you want to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. About two weeks before the event, you will be asked to confirm your attendance.

entry.title: Re: publicaciones en ingles?
entry.content:
Hola @Darling_Astudillo,

Antes que nada, bienvenida a la SAP Community.

Es cierto que la gran mayoria del contenido en la plataforma es en ingles pero claro que podes publicar en tu idioma nativo. En SAP Community podes encontrar contenido en otros idiomas, por ej. portugues, japones, chino, etc. Dicho eso, existe una comunidad SAP hispanohablante bastante importante. Yo personalmente he publicado contenido en espa√±ol aqui hace mucho tiempo.... pero la gran mayoria es en ingles. Tambien, si publicas algo en espa√±ol siempre podes utilizar algo como Google Translate para traducirlo e incluirlo en el mismo blog post. Inclusive, podria ser algo como un link a la herramienta de Google Translate y asi la gente que no habla espa√±ol tambien lo puede acceder, por ej. https://community-sap-com.translate.goog/t5/welcome-corner-discussions/publicaciones-en-ingles/td-p/14127525?_x_tr_sl=es&_x_tr_tl=en&_x_tr_hl=en-US&_x_tr_pto=wapp.

Dependiendo de donde estas, podes tambien encontrar en SAP Community grupos hispanohablantes y te podes unir a ellos - Americas y en Espa√±a hay un par.

Por ultimo, hay gente que tambien crea contenido en espa√±ol relacionado con el mundo SAP... te recomiendo que les des un vistazo:

  • @AAncos : https://aancos.com
  • @Sandra_Solis : Mundo ABAPER

entry.title: SAP Community Escape House for July ‚Äì SAP Cloud Application Event Hub ‚öΩÔ∏è üèÜ üèüÔ∏è
entry.content:
The seventh SAP Developer Challenge of the year is now available! The Developer Advocates have created the SAP Community Escape House - a virtual escape house (consisting of multiple rooms) that you can play in your browser. Read on for all the details.

SAP Developer Challenges are all about having fun, trying new things, and learning along the way. You can also earn a badge in the SAP Community upon successful completion. For this year, all SAP Developer Challenges will happen in the SAP Community Escape House. For each challenge, we will unlock a new room in the house, and they all have a specific focus topic. Completing a challenge means successfully escaping the room by solving a series of coding-related tasks/questions. This month is all about events between SAP cloud applications, specifically the BTP service - SAP Cloud Application Event Hub.

How to participate

Visit the SAP Community Escape House and enter your numeric SAP Community user ID. If you don't know your user ID, go to your SAP Community profile. You can find the numeric ID at the end of the URL.

SAP Community Escape House - Enter your SAP Community ID


Once you see the SAP Community Escape House, select the SAP Cloud Application Event Hub room and start exploring it.

The user interface of an escape room includes the room itself as well as a terminal. You can click the objects in the room to receive tips. Like in a real (physical) escape room, you will have to try out a few things and explore the room until you receive helpful tips and, eventually, instructions. These tips and instructions are printed on the terminal next to the room. The terminal is also used to submit solutions to tasks. Read the instructions you receive carefully to understand how.

 

If you successfully escape the room (you will know when that happens), you will receive a badge in the SAP Community. We will assign the badges once the challenge closes.

The schedule

The SAP Cloud Application Event Hub room will be unlocked on July 1st and will stay unlocked until the end of the year. However, the challenge closes on July 31st, so you must escape the room until then to qualify for a badge. Unlike the previous year, this SAP Developer Challenge does not consist of weekly sub-challenges. The next room (next challenge) will be unlocked in August.

Good luck and happy escaping!
